title: [DOC-FIX] mlflow.azureml.deploy doesnt work with model_uri :models:/<model_name>/<stage> format
body:
### URL(s) with the issue: https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.azureml.html#mlflow.azureml.deploy

Observed a conflict between the mlflow document &  code . mlflow.azureml.deploy doc says model_uri takes 
`models:/<model_name>/<stage>` format but code accepts only `models:/<model_name>/<model_version>`

while the code comment says it is not supported yet
```
# If we are passed a 'models' uri, we will attempt to extract a name and version which
# can be used to retreive an AzureML Model. This will ignore stage based model uris,
```
##code:
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/9ce80db9c344076806264f00cb80c17c0efef808/mlflow/azureml/__init__.py#L397


Passed model uri: models:/model-name/Production got into error
`ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'Production'`

### Description of proposal (what needs changing):
Remove `models:/<model_name>/ <stage>` from the model_uri parameter option in the doc
